III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Description qualifications
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was previously placed at the facility in 2021. There was an
exchange of messages between the youth and a staff member
that appeared sexual in nature. It is unknown if the relationship
was occurring while the youth was in placement. There was an
incident in which this staff member made the youth run naked in
the woods. The staff member would drive the youth back to their
home while under the influence which occurred after placement at
the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 7, 2025 and on the phone on September 25, 2025.
Administrator reported she received a phone call from Father with
concerns that Youth A and Supervisor 1 were potentially in an
inappropriate relationship. She reported Father looked at Youth
2

A’s cell phone and saw him messaging Supervisor 1.
Administrator reported Father was not clear exactly what the
messages were stating, but they were sexual in nature. She
reported Youth A was placed at the facility from November 2020
until May 2021. Administrator reported Supervisor 1 was the
campus-wide supervisor at that time. She reported Supervisor 1
had a positive relationship with Youth A, and there were no noted
concerns during the time Youth A was placed there. Administrator
reported Father was unaware of when the relationship started and
did not believe anything happened at the facility, but noted that is
how Youth A met Supervisor 1. She reported Father stated
Supervisor 1 had driven Youth A back to his home, and
Supervisor 1 appeared to be under the influence. Administrator
reported Father confirmed this drive occurred when Youth A was
discharged, and Supervisor 1 was not working at the facility. She
reported Supervisor 1 has not worked at the facility since May
2024. Administrator reported there was no concern with
Supervisor 1 having inappropriate relationships with any youth at
the facility, including Youth A. She reported she was unaware of
Supervisor 1 talking with or seeing Youth A post his discharge
from the facility. Administrator reported she is unaware of how
long this has been going on. This consultant also spoke with
Administrator about the reported concerns Youth A made about
Staff 1. Consultant spoke with Administrator about Youth A’s
disclosing of going to Staff 1’s home and Staff 1 being sexually
inappropriate towards Youth A. It was explained that Youth A
disclosed Staff 1 attempted to touch him inappropriately, made
sexually inappropriate comments to him, and made him feel
unsafe at Staff 1’s home. She reported Staff 1 has not worked at
the facility since August 2021. Administrator reported there were
no concerns reported about the relationship between Youth A and
Staff 1. She reported Staff 1 was the staff member who helped
calm Youth A down at times. Administrator reported she was also
unaware of Staff 1 being a mentor to Youth A. When asked about
the mentorship policy at the facility, Administrator reported she is
unable to locate the exact policy from that time frame of this
situation due to an issue with the facility’s archived files. She
reported she knows staff were supposed to obtain administrative
permission to continue to have a relationship with a youth that was
discharged from the facility for mentorship purposes. Administrator
reported she knows Supervisor 1 was a mentor to a different
youth who had been discharged from the facility, as she was the
one to give him that approval before. She reported she was only
unaware at that time who gave permission for Youth A to have
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 as mentors.
3

Father was interviewed via phone on August 11, 2025. Father
reported Youth A had returned home to his care on 08/09/2021.
He had reported Youth A spent time at St. John’s Home
Residential Facility from 11/30/2020 to 05/18/2021. Father
reported Youth A went to another facility for a short period of time
before coming back into his care. He reported Youth A met
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 at St. John’s Home Residential Facility.
Father reported he did many visits with Youth A when he was at
this facility and noted Youth A never mentioned any concerns with
Supervisor 1 or Staff 1. He reported Youth A really looked up to
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 as supportive people in his life. Father
reported after Youth A was discharged from the facility, he had
Father bring him up to visit with the staff. He reported during that
visit, Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 were present. Father reported
during that interaction, it was asked if Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
could be mentors to Youth A when he is in his care. He reported
he saw no concerns about this, as these two people were
supporting Youth A when he was placed at the facility. Father
reported Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 had approval from an
administrator from the facility to be a mentor to Youth A when he
was returned home. He reported he could not remember who the
administrator was that gave the approval, but did note it was a
male and stated he was present when the official approval was
given. Father reported Youth A had seen Staff 1 a handful of times
when he was returned to Father’s home, and then the relationship
stopped. He reported Youth A stated the relationship stopped
because Staff 1 was busy with his own family. Father reported
Supervisor 1 had more visits with Youth A than Staff 1. He
reported there were concerns brought to light that during these
visits, Supervisor 1 may have driven Youth A while under the
influence of substances. Father reported he also heard a rumor of
Supervisor 1 having a video of Youth A running into the woods
naked but never found any evidence of that. He clarified that both
incidents happened after Youth A was discharged from the facility.
Father reported when he found the text messages on Youth A’s
phone between Youth A and Supervisor 1, he felt these were
sexually inappropriate and made him have concerns about the
relationship between Supervisor 1 and Youth A. Father reported
he sent a screenshot of those messages to Administrator. He
reported Youth A was recently interviewed by law enforcement
about these concerns, and Youth A did not disclose any concerns
about Supervisor 1. Father reported Youth A did disclose to law
enforcement sexual abuse concerns about Staff 1. He reported he
did not have the exact details of this, but noted these sexual
abuse concerns happened after Youth A was discharged from the
4

facility. Father reported it made more sense to him now why the
relationship stopped between Youth A and Staff 1.
Law Enforcement was interviewed via phone on August 15,
2025. Law Enforcement reported Youth A was interviewed by a
courtesy police department on August 8, 2025. During this
interview, Youth A reported about four years ago, when he was
placed with Father, Staff 1 picked him up from home to go to the
movies. After the movies, Youth A went to Staff 1’s home to play
video games. While at Staff 1’s home, Staff 1 began to masturbate
in front of Youth A and asked him if he wanted to touch him. Law
Enforcement reported Youth A was asked to confirm where Staff
1’s apartment was located when the reported concerns of Staff 1
masturbating in front of him occurred and Youth A disclosed the
same address that Staff 1 was registered to live at. Law
Enforcement reported Youth A did not make any concerning
disclosures about Supervisor 1. It was reported the video in
question was during a time Youth A was intoxicated and dared to
run into the woods naked. There is no confirmation that a video
exists. Law Enforcement reported all the concerning events
occurred during the time Youth A was placed with Father and not
at the facility. He reported he is setting up a plan to reinterview
Youth A and will include this consultant.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his home on
September 2, 2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement.
Youth A reported he met Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 at the facility
when he was residing there. He reported Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
were great staff members to him there, and he never assaulted
either of them. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 would
listen to him and try to help him when he was escalating. He
reported he was placed at the facility for a few months and then
went to another facility for roughly three months before he was
placed back with Father. Youth A reported he did go visit
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 at the facility with Father when he was
going to be discharged back home. He reported during that visit
he was able to get Supervisor 1 and Staff 1’s phone numbers to
remain in contact with him after discharge, so they could be
mentors to him. Youth A reported he believed someone in
management at the facility approved of this to happen and stated
that Father was there to confirm that. He reported Supervisor 1
and Staff 1 were professional at the facility, and he reported
nothing inappropriate ever happened to him while at the facility.
Youth A reported Staff 1 did make a comment to Youth A when
they were alone that Youth A felt was an odd comment and could
be taken in a sexual manner. When asked what the comment
5

was, Youth A stated he could not remember, but it made him feel
a little bit uncomfortable. He reported he never reported this
concern to anyone, and no one else was around when the
comment was made. When asked about visiting Supervisor 1, he
reported he had visited Supervisor 1 multiple times. He reported
Supervisor 1 is a great mentor to him and would pick him up when
Youth A was in any trouble, such as if he was drunk or in a bad
situation. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 had provided him with
alcohol before and that he had slept at Supervisor 1’s home. He
reported one time, he did have Supervisor 1 pick him up when he
was intoxicated, and Youth A slept in Supervisor 1’s car. When
Youth A woke up, he stated he felt weird but could not prove that
anything had happened to him, but he felt like Supervisor 1 did
something to him. He reported he could not give any more details
than this, but he felt uncomfortable. Youth A denied anything
sexual happened with Supervisor 1. He reported, though
sometimes when he would hang out with Supervisor 1, he would
make comments about how they could not go into this part of town
because he did not want his coworkers to see him with Youth A,
but Youth A did not think anything of it. When asked about his
time with Staff 1, he reported he only saw Staff 1 a few times. He
reported he remembers going to the movies with him one time,
and another time they played mini golf. Youth A reported after he
played mini golf, he went back to Staff 1’s apartment and played
video games. He reported at the apartment, Staff 1 tried to touch
Youth A’s penis over Youth A’s pants and then tried to stick his
hands down Youth A’s pants. Youth A reported he then asked
Staff 1 to go home immediately. Youth A denied Staff 1 was
touching himself or asked Youth A to touch Staff 1. He reported
this occurred when he was 14 years old and stated he did not see
Staff 1 again after that. Youth A reported Staff 1 never touched
him at the facility or made sexual advances towards him at the
facility.
Staff 1 was attempted to be interviewed via phone on
September 25, 2025, and October 1, 2025. Voicemails were
left asking for a return call, but Staff 1 never returned the call.
Law Enforcement did send a copy of his notes from his face
to face interview with Staff 1 on September 23, 2025. These
notes are located within the document section of this report.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on September 25,
2025. Supervisor 1 reported he worked at the facility when Youth
A was placed there. He reported he had a positive relationship
with Youth A. Supervisor 1 denied ever hearing any concerns from
Youth A about a staff member being inappropriate with him. He
6

reported there was a concern with Youth A trying to be sexually
inappropriate with female staff at the facility, but he was redirected
from this behavior. Supervisor 1 reported Father would come up to
the facility to work with Youth A and help calm down Youth A’s
behaviors at times. He reported Father had asked Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 to mentor Youth A when he was discharged from
residential care. Supervisor 1 reported he agreed to be Youth A’s
mentor when he returned to Father’s home. He reported he
believes this was also approved by administration at the facility
but cannot remember who it was. Supervisor 1 reported he was
also a mentor to another youth who was discharged from the
facility and had to go through a process as well to be approved to
maintain that relationship. He denied there ever being any
inappropriate relationship between him and Youth A during the
time Youth A was placed at the facility and when he was a mentor
to Youth A post his discharge from the facility. He denied the
original allegations of the case and stated he has always
maintained appropriate boundaries with Youth A. Supervisor 1
denied ever sending inappropriate text messages to Youth A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 7, 2025. Supervisor 2 confirmed he worked at the facility
during the time Youth A was placed there. He reported Supervisor
1 and Staff 1 had a positive relationship with Youth A. Supervisor
2 reported he never saw or heard of that relationship being
inappropriate. He reported he was unaware of Supervisor 1 or
Staff 1 having contact with Youth A after Youth A was discharged
from the facility. Supervisor 2 directly supervised Staff 1 at the
facility. He did not report any concerns about Staff 1 and his
relationship with the youth.
Therapist was interviewed via phone on September 29, 2025.
Therapist reported she worked with Youth A during the time he
was placed at the facility. She reported he never disclosed any
concerns about inappropriate behaviors from staff to him.
Therapist reported Youth A did get along well with Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1. She reported he never expressed any concerns
about them to her. Therapist reported she never saw Staff 1 or
Supervisor 1 have any inappropriate contact with any youth at the
facility. She reported she was unaware of Supervisor 1 or Staff 1
being a mentor to Youth A once he was placed with Father.
Therapist reported since Youth A went to another facility after
being discharged from this facility, she did not have contact with
Youth A post-discharge. She reported the message facility tells
staff if they want to mentor a youth when they leave the facility, to
7

make sure it goes through their foster care team, and best
practice is to notify leadership at the facility.
Documents reviewed:
- Youth A’s File at the facility- Youth A was placed at the
facility from 11/30/2020 to 05/18/2021. There were no
incident reports noting concerns between Supervisor 1 and
Youth A or between Staff 1 and Youth A. The incident
reports that did involve Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 with Youth
A were documented approved restraint holds due to Youth
A’s unsafe behavior. There were some incident reports
noting Youth A showing sexual behaviors towards peers or
trying to talk to other youth in sexual conversations. There
were never any documented incident reports noting Youth
A reporting or other staff having concerns about staff
talking or showing sexualized behaviors to him.
- Supervisor 1 Human Resource File- Supervisor 1 was
employed at the facility during the time Youth A was placed
there. He had the following disciplinary actions noted within
his HR file: 3/20218- Verbal warning about documenting
medication correctly; 2019- Verbal warning due to joking
around with a coworker and making the comment to go “kill
herself.”; 11/2021- Verbal warning-Supervisor 1 did not
report a concern a youth reported about a peer, and this
was found within a DCWL investigation. Supervisor 1
moved from the CCI side of the program to the
Independent Living Plus (ILP) program 01/08/2024.
Supervisor 1 was terminated on 05/08/2024 due to having
negative interactions with his supervisor at the ILP
program.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 was employed at
the facility during the time he was placed there. Staff 1 has
one written warning noted within his HR file from
01/30/2021. This written warning was due to concerns of
Staff 1 trying to tell staff what to do within a situation rather
than going to his supervisor and for not following the
COVID-19 policy. Staff 1 did put in his two weeks’ notice at
the facility and his last day of employment at the facility was
08/05/2021.
8

- Email sent from Law Enforcement dated September 23,
2025- Law Enforcement sent this consultant his interview
notes that took place with Staff 1 on September 23, 2025.
Law Enforcement gave permission for this consultant to
move forward with the rest of their investigation as he will
be submitting his report. He reported that due to the lack of
evidence this case will be denied. Law Enforcement police
report number is 25-144745.
o Interview notes from Law Enforcement with Staff
1- Staff 1 was interviewed face to face with Law
Enforcement. He confirmed he worked with Youth A
at the facility in the year 2021. Staff 1 reported
Youth A would often escalate and would require a lot
of staff attention. He reported Youth A would often
lie or run outside, knowing that staff would have to
follow him, and do other attention seeking behavior.
Staff 1 reported Youth A would often say something,
then take it back quickly. He reported he could not
recall any specific conversations with Youth A. Staff
1 acknowledged there could have been
conversations that Youth A brought up that were
hypersexualized that he may have talked to him and
processed or worked through. He also recalled
Youth A would make sexual comments about female
staff members often. Staff 1 denied he ever had a
conversation about dating Youth A after he turned
eighteen. Staff 1 confirmed he acted as a mentor for
Youth A after Youth A was discharged. He stated
this was facilitated at the family’s request. Law
Enforcement asked Staff 1 if he had ever had Youth
A back to his house, he stated he couldn’t remember
ever having Youth A over. Staff 1 took a long time to
answer, therefore Law Enforcement clarified, telling
him that he had good evidence that Staff 1 had
Youth A over. Staff 1 then stated he could have had
Youth A over, and they would have only watched a
movie and nothing else. Law Enforcement asked
about Youth A’s specific allegations of inappropriate
touching, which Staff 1 denied ever happening.
9

Text messages between Youth A and Supervisor 1 that Father
sent to Administrator - It should be noted that is unknown the
date of these text messages. Youth A: “Got my nut off so I’m
happy”; Supervisor 1: “But were they happy?”; Youth A: “More
then happy”; Supervisor 1: “Good for you and them. Is that how
you rolled your ankle? Doing to much.”; Youth A: “Bettt”;
Supervisor 1: “I’ll be there around 1130. Patience. That’s plenty of
time to get one more round in. lol.”; Youth A: “And only asked that
bc I take to long.”
Analysis The facility is found in rule compliance. Within the interviews of
Youth A and Father it was found that Supervisor 1 and Staff 1
were mentors for Youth A post his discharge from the facility.
Father confirmed this was approved by a person from the
administration team. All the noted concerns Youth A had with
Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 occurred when Youth A was discharged
from the facility and denied anything concerning happening while
he was at the facility.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was provided to make sure there is a clear
process for if a staff wants to become a mentor to a youth when
they discharge from the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
